metadata.title: CVE-2020-15669 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
When aborting an operation, such as a fetch, an abort signal may be deleted while alerting the objects to be notified. This results in a use-after-free and we presume that with enough effort it could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.12 and Thunderbird < 68.12.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
